Álvaro,  a sus 65 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de arepas de maíz, para luego venderlas; actividad que realiza hace aproximadamente 15 años, luego de haber adquirido la experiencia cuando trabajaba en diversos restaurantes de la región. Él vive en compañía de su esposa en unión libre y no tiene hijos, por lo que sólo cuenta con el apoyo de ella. Álvaro se levanta en horas de la madrugada para comenzar a elaborar sus arepas de forma artesanal, pues muele el maíz a mano, luego de moldear las arepas, estas son asadas al carbón y, en horas de la tarde sale con su esposa a distribuirlas por toda  la zona, con lo cual obtiene los ingresos para subsistir diariamente.
El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de un molino eléctrico $1.000.000, ollas para cocinar el maíz $300.000 y comprar maíz al por mayor $700.000, con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción ya que ahorraría tiempo al momento de moler el maíz y así podría utilizar este tiempo adicional en la distribución del producto hacia otras regiones cercanas, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida con una buena estabilidad económica. Álvaro sueña con posicionar  su producto como un alimento 100% natural, que sea reconocido en toda la región y así poder generar más oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 65, has been making and selling corn flatbread, a skill he acquired working in various local restaurants, for 15 years. He lives in a free union with his wife and has no children; therefore, he only has his wife's support. Álvaro gets up at dawn to make his homemade flatbread. He grinds the corn by hand, shapes and then grills the bread over wood, and goes out in the afternoon with his wife to sell the products throughout the neighborhood. The income allows them to support themselves each day. 

He has applied for a loan to buy an electric mill ($1000), pots to cook corn ($300), and wholesale corn ($700) to increase production. He will save time grinding the corn and will use the extra time to sell his product in other nearby neighborhoods. This will allow him to increase his income and improve his standard of living and finances. Álvaro dreams of marketing his product as 100% natural and having it be recognized throughout the area so that he can create more jobs.

loans.use: to buy an electric mill ($1000), pots to cook corn ($300), and wholesale corn ($700).

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son mari et leur enfant de 06ans à Lomé. Âgée de 31ans, elle revend des produits de mercerie dans une boutique depuis 2010 et s'y plait car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer au besoin de la famille. Son second prêt lui servira de s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de clients. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle espère améliorer le niveau de l'activité et assurer l’épanouissent de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives with her husband and their six-year-old in Lomé. Now 31 years old, Akossiwa has been selling notions from a shop since 2010 and enjoys doing so, since her sales bring in profits that allow her to contribute to the needs of the family.

Her second loan will allow Akossiwa to purchase supplies in order to better meet the needs of her customers. In the future, she hopes to increase her sales and ensure that her family thrives.

loans.use: To purchase notions.

loans.name: Toeurm's Group

texts.en:
Toeurm is 42 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom still rely on her since three of them are still in school and one is too young for schooling. 

To struggle for a living, Toeurm grows rice on three hectares of land and plants corn on one hectare. She has been engaged in this business for 22 years, earning about KHR 23,500 per day. 

This is not the first loan for Toeurm with Kiva's partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She has repaid her past three loans with success and they have enabled her to improve her lifestyle, better than before. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain a high-yield from her cash-crops and to triple her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 53 years old and married with six children.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a vegetable vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase different vegetable to sell.

Irene has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the vegetable vending for four years and also earns an income from farming rice, food vending and general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Irene aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es de la ciudad de Pilar, comenta que su papa es contador y que su mamá trabaja de ama de casa. Desde los 14 años trabajó con su papá en la Contabilidad y  por esa razón estudia esta carrera.
Cuenta que quiere poder tener su propio negocio para poder aplicar sus conocimientos que ha adquirido por medio de sus estudios. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Diego is from the city of Pilar. His father is an accountant, and his mother is a homemaker. He is studying accounting because he has been working with his father since he was 14. He wants to have his own business and apply the knowledge he has garnered from his studies. He has applied for a loan to pay his college fees so the he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay for college courses.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOGOTIERI, un des villages de la commune de ZANGARADOUGOU dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  SOGONA  debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences, payer les frais de  labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 130.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi I Group are married women who average 46 years of age and six children each, and all live in polygamous families in Bogotieri, a village within the Zangaradougou commune in Mali's third administrative region of Sikasso.

The group's members work with microfinance institution [MFI] Soro Yiriwaso to conduct successful farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan cycle with the MFI and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

The crop is groundnuts, [to be grown by] Sogona, standing in the middle [of the photo]. With her loan, Sogona plans to purchase enough seeds and fertilizer, and to pay the cost of labor, for one hectare. The crop will be sold in the village and throughout Sikasso after the harvest, to a group of customers including men and women.

Sogona expects to turn a profit of 130,000 CFA francs with this loan. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, seeds, and labor.

loans.name: Adom's Group

texts.en:
“Adom” is a group consisting of two women who consider themselves to be hard-working in their everyday lives. Pricilla is 46 years old, married with three children. 

She works selling provisions and bags and this loan will help her buy more of these products so she can earn more profit. She has been doing this work for 10 years but the process has been slow. For that reason she is resorting to a loan amount of GHS 1500 so that she can buy enough and make enough profit.

Margaret is her friend and a group member of Adom. They have been together as members of the same group and friends for six years and this is their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy and sell provisions and bags to customers.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Age 43 and a citizen originally from Kampong Cham province, Sreymom is a married mother of three dependent children. Her main source of income is from rice-cropping. This is the business that she has had for ages and she is able to earn about KHR 25,000 per day. 

With this loan, Sreymom and her three members are second-time borrowers. After the successful loan which she has repaid back, she can manage a new business for extra income. 

For this cycle, the total of her group loan is KHR 3,900,000, of which KHR 1,200,000 is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fees. She hopes this loan will support her business on-time and will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Uaina

texts.en:
Uaina is a 47-year-old married woman with eight children.

Uaina would like to start growing taro crops to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow.

She has been a member of SPBD for 1 year. Uaina will spend her profits to support her family and save money for her childrens' educations.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer,bush-knives,chemicals and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en:
"Alofa is 35 years old and married with 6 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows taro and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Alofa needs a loan to buy chemicals,wheelbarrow,backpack sprayer and bushknives. 
She has been a member of SBPD in 2013. Alofa will use the profits from her sales to help her children's education."

loans.use: to buy chemicals,wheelbarrow,backpack sprayer and bushknives

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
This is Pastor. His previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to have more plants to sell. His income from his sales helped him in their everyday needs. His wife, who is a housewife, helps him in the business. Together they think of ways to expand their business.

He would now like to apply for an 18,000 PHP loan and he will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Pastor dreams of being more prosperous in his business and hopes to make a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for pots, wire, fertilizers and other things needed in his business.

loans.name: Surbeh Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Fatmata was born in Feredugu village, 45 years ago. She is married, and the couple has four children.  Fatmata sells palm oil and has been a businesswoman for many years, now.
 
With the help of this loan, Fatmata and the other group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy gallons of palm oil, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es una estudiante de la carrera de la Fisioterapia, comenta que sus ganas de salir adelante es lo que la inspira a estudiar y poder terminar su carrera. También quiere poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten atención en su salud.
Se esta esforzando al maximo para poder ser una excelente profesional. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las clases, y también para poder comprar sus materiales de estudio. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Griselda is a Physiotherapy student, she comments that her desire to succeed is what motivates her to study and be able to complete her degree. She also wants to help people who need medical attention.

She is working hard to be able to become an excellent professional. She is requesting this loan to invest it in her course fees and also to buy study materials. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for university classes and buy study materials.

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
Noelia tiene 22 años y es Hija única vive en un ambiente tranquilo y siempre le gustó estudiar. Le gusta enseñar en los colegios pero su objetivo principal de ella es enseñar en la Facultad Nacional.
Y una de sus aspiraciones es llegar a ser Supervisora general del Departamento Central en el Área de la Educación. Ella está estudiando para ser docente, y quiere ser una gran profesional el día de mañana.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que estos son muy costosos y le gustaría poder cubrirlos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Noelia is 22 and an only child lives in a peaceful environment and always wanted to study. She would like to be a secondary school teacher, but her main goal is to teach at the National School. 

One of her aspirations is to be general supervisor at the Central Department for Education. She is studying to be a teacher and wants to be a great professional in future.

She is requesting the loan to invest it in education fees, as these are very expensive and she would like to cover them. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses

loans.name: Nenalyn

texts.en:
Nenalyn is 33 years old and married with six children.

Nenalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, bread, canned goods, chips, etc.

Nenalyn has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Nenalyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, bread, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Naiyan

texts.en:
Naiyan, a rural villager from Kampong Cham Province's Tbaung Khmum District, is 49 years old. She has seven dependent children. Naiyan has earned a living through farming rice on 3-hectares of farmland. Having engaged in this business for 30 years, Naiyan is able to save up to 19 US dollars per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the second-cycle loan for Naiyan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past loan, which she successfully paid back, has helped her to sustain her living condition as well as her business in a gradual manner. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter, a 21-year-old freshman in a local university specializing in Accounting. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and also help her daughter to obtain a higher education and end up with a good job after graduation to support the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Seanghai

texts.en:
Seanghai is 28 years old and married. She is a mother of four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for several years. They supplement their family’s income by catching fish. Together, they can earn about 16,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Seanghai is in her first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is now asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to expand her field business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
25 years old, Lucia lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Lucia completed 3rd grade. She and her fiance are living together and they have two children  who are presently attending school. She started her business with a little money from her older sister which she used to established her business. For three years now she been running a table where she sells onions, rice, palm oil, Vita, pepper, salt, etc. She  spends 8 hours on her business.

A problem she faces is insufficient income, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, Vita, pepper, salt, etc. for her business. Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her children through high school.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, Vita, peppers, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: The Spritens Girls Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 37-year-old Vine from Mutare. Vine is the group leader for The Spritens Girls. She is divorced with three children and two are attending school.  Vine runs a retail business which sells clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge she faces is that of bad debtors and a slow market. Vine has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes and footwear to sell to mostly working class people in town. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Vine plans to own a boutique shop in town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale in and around town

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
This is Felisa, 59, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Honesto, a vendor, and she is the mother to their children. She together with her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Felisa operates the buy and sell business for her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells them for a little profit. Her products are women’s clothes and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like women’s clothing to expand her product inventory.

Felisa dreams that her business will be successful and hopes to have a peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise like women's clothing needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a ambulant grocery item business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Sakhorn is 41 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising chickens and ducks as primary sources of income. They can earn about 25,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs.
 
Sakhorn has been with VisionFund for six cycles. She wisely and successfully used her first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her chickens and ducks. This loan will enable her to increase her farmland and her rice production to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and feed for her chickens and ducks

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jagannath Group

texts.en:
This group, formed in the year 2010, is called “Jagannath”.  It is a group composed of four women members of the village of Bhuliasikuan, located in the Nuapada district, one of the poorest districts of India.

Debaki is one of the members of this group, and has raised her hand in the photo. She is fifty years old, and her family consists of her husband, one son, her daughter-in-law and her mother-in-law. 

Debaki has been running a small bakery factory in her house with the help of her husband for the last fifteen years. In the factory, bakery items like bread, cream roll, toast, etc. are being prepared. She has engaged four skilled laborers for the processing and making of bakery items. Her husband supplies the products to 3-4 nearby towns within a 20 km radius. Debaki earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR, which is not sufficient to materialize her dream. 

Debaki says that owing to better quality, design, packing and forms of her products, there is a lot of demand from the locality, but due to shortage of stock, she is not able to meet her customers’ demands. She now wants to buy more raw materials to increase her production level to meet the demand and grab her customers. The present loan amount will be used by her to purchase raw materials like oil, sugar, dough, etc. in bulk, which will reduce her purchasing and transportation costs. 

Debaki dreams to produce quality biscuit products, for which she has to hire professional workers from outside. She also wants to save money for completing her half-constructed house building.

The other three active members of the group are Panchali, running a milk business, and Kalpalata and Mithila, running hand-loom work successfully.

loans.use: to purchase of oil, sugar, dough, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Nel

texts.es: Pedro, a sus 40 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos de 4 y 11 años y vive con su esposa en unión libre. Hace 23 años se dedica a la vida del campo y a las labores agrícolas, tiene cultivos de zanahoria, fríjol, arveja y papa los cuales son cultivados a escala, luego los cosecha y los vende para así generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. “Hay que trabajar muy duro en el campo porque la agricultura es una actividad muy incierta y hay diversos factores que ponen en riesgo la labor, como por ejemplo las vacunas que piden los grupos al margen de la ley, los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas, el clima y la competencia que hay en toda la región” con estas palabras Pedro expresa las dificultades por las que ha pasado, pero él sigue luchando arduamente porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia y no permite que esas situaciones negativas lo afecten. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (pesticidas, fungicidas, abonos) para continuar con sus cultivos y sacar buenas cosechas para así mejorar sus ingresos y poder cumplir el sueño de ampliar sus cultivos, porque quiere brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos, y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro, 40, is the father of two children aged 4 and 11 and lives with his common law wife. He has been a farmer for 23 years and has crops of carrots, beans, peas and potatoes, which he grows to scale. He then harvests them and sells them to generate income to sustain his household.

"I have to work very hard because agriculture is an uncertain activity and there are various factors that put the work at risk such as black market vaccines, the high cost of agricultural supplies, the climate and the competition in the region." With these works Pedro expresses the difficulties that he has experienced, but he keeps working hard as he wants to protect his family and not allow these negative situations to affect them.

This is why he is requesting a loan to invest it in agricultural supplies (pesticides, fungicides, manure) in order to continue growing his crops and to achieve good harvests to improve his income and fulfill his dreams of increasing his crops, because he wants to offer his children a good education and a better quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (pesticides, fungicides and manure)

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children, aged 15, 12, 9 and 3 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling.  

In 2002, Kadiatu established her charcoal business. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,600,000. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal and rice by the bag for resale, and to pay the transport costs. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to earns more profit, educate her children up to the university level, build houses, and get another international business. The loan helps Kadiatu to improve on her business and also educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en: Kou is a 42-year-old who lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources and where living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest most populous county in Liberia. She described herself as a hard-working woman. She completed ninth grade, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. She is married, traditionally, and her husband is a security guard. They have eight children between the ages of 3 and 22, she said. Only two of her children are in school, and they all live in the same house, which was built by her husband. With a little money from her husband, she was able to establish her business, in which she sells dried bush meat at a table in the local market. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is having only a few goods on her table. She is applying for a loan to buy more dried bush meat for her business. Her plan is to build a modern house one day.

loans.use: to buy more dried bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Wewee

texts.en:
Wewee is 39 years old, and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County. Sanniquelle is rich in natural resources, and living conditions are much better than in the capital of Liberia. It is the second most populated county in Liberia. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She completed 9th grade, and she has lived all her life in Sanniquelle. Traditionally she is married, and her husband is a security guard. They have three children between 22 and 10 years old. Only two of her children are in school, and they all live in the same house, which was built by her husband. 

With a little money from her husband she was able to establish her table business where she sells fish in the local market. She spends 10 hours a day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is too few goods on her table; she is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is 30 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County. Nimba is the second-most populous county in Liberia and is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Norie describes herself as a hardworking woman. She completed seventh grade, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. She is traditionally married, and her husband works with the immigration. Together, they have five children between 1 week and 10 years old. She said that only three of her children are in school, and they all live in the same house which was built by her husband.

With a little money from her husband, she was able to establish her table business in the local market. There, she sells palm oil. She spends 10 hours per day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces in the business, is having too few goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business inventory. Her plan is to build her dream house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has three children. For the past six years, Kennedy has been a farmer who sells milk, eggs, and crops. He finds milking to be the most enjoyable part of farming and states that operating costs are the biggest challenge. Animals on his farm have been given names of Leel and Met. When asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for his loan, replied, "low interest rate."  Kennedy learned record keeping during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. His highest monthly expense is farming costs and he expects his loan to benefit his family by "increasing the food supply." 

Kennedy is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kennedy owns a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on their loans. Kennedy has a mosquito net and running water in his household but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, a TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, where available land is scarce. He has six children and has been doing this work for 33 years. His primary income sources are;milk,poultry personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy farming' His biggest challenge is 'Lack of enough money,labor.'Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyabarati.'

Mark was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'It has a lower interest and the officers are understanding.'This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Using the money according to the intended purpose.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Mark replied 'With the profits he make it will take care of our needs,.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mark owns the following: 'poultry, cow' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Esther, who lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources and where living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia. She described herself as a hard-working woman. She was unfortunate not to attend school. She is married traditionally. Her husband is a farmer. They have eight children between 9 and 15, she said. Only five of her children are presently in school, and they all live in the same house. She started her business with a little money from her husband. She has been able to establish her business, where she sells salt, Vita (a juice drink), onions, seasoning oil, and the like from a table in the local market. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is that she has only a few goods on her table. She is applying for a loan to buy more salt, Vita, onions, and seasoning oil for her business. Her plan is to build a modern house one day.

loans.use: to buy more salt, Vita (a fruit drink), onions and seasoning oil for her business.

loans.name: Youhn

texts.en: A 37-year-old Youhn lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, and where living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia. She was unfortunate not to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have five children between the ages of 7 and 24, only three of whom are presently attending school and live at home. She started her business with a little money from her husband. She has established her business and, for seven years, she been selling oil and rice from a table in the local market. She spends nine hours on her business. A problem she faces is her small income. She is applying for a loan to buy more oil and rice for her business. Her dreams are to open a shop one day and to see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Tankesu Group

texts.en: Pictured here are a group of entrepreneurs from the township of Lunsar in northern Sierra Leone. This group of entrepreneurs has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to apply for loans of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan, each will be able to add more inventory to her business. This will attract more customers, lead to more sales, and consequently improve their living standards. Margret is the featured leader of this group. The 53-year-old is a native of Yille village. She is married to a trader, and the couple have three children. Margret sells a wide variety of items, including medicines, mints, sweets and biscuits. Margret is going to use her share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy medicines, mints, sweets, biscuits, and the like in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Savoeurn's Group

texts.en: Savoeurn is a mother of four children. She is her late 30s. She and the rest of her family reside in Kampong Cham province. She deals with the daily costs of living by farming and trading rice. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, earning about 35,000 KHR per day. This is the second microloan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Savoeurn’s Group, which consists of three female members. Savoeurn succeeded in repaying her past loan, and she has used it wisely to conduct her rice trading in a smooth manner. Now she is the leader of her group, and she is applying for 1,200,000 KHR, the same loan amount as each of her co-borrowers. As the leader, she will spend a portion of the loan to buy rice for resale, as well as a small portion to buy potash for her crop. She hopes to increase her income and make her living conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sai Baba Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Sai Baba. It was formed in the year 2010. All four women members of this group are from the village Badi in Nuapada district of Odisha, India and   belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category.  People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. Hema standing second from right with raised hand, is the featured members of the group. She is 43 years of age and lives with her husband, two sons aged 18 and 12 and one daughter of 14 years of age. 

Hema has been running a dairy farm with two cows for the last seven years. Her husband is a farmer and looks after the vegetable cultivation and sales business. Presently Hema is getting 6 liters of milk per day and supplying it to a tea stall at a nearby town @ 16 INR per litre. With this small income she is hardly able to manage her household expenses as well as farming expenses. 

So to enhance that income Hema has planned to invest a part of the present loan to buy another cow and purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides from the other part. Hema dreams of developing a big dairy farm in future and repairing her dug well for vegetable cultivation.

The other three members of the group Binapani, Debaki and Anle are running a fish selling business and a vegetable vending business respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a cow, seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 33 years old and lives in Ganta, one of the most talked-about cities in Nimba County. Nimba is the second-most populous county in Liberia, and it is rich in natural resources. Fanta is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between 17 and 2, who are presently attending school and live at home.

For the past seven years, Fanta has been running a shop where she sells used clothes. She makes a lot of profit, because she is the only one who sells quality used clothes in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes to resell at her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to resell at her business

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en: Meet this group of entrepreneurs from the township of Lunsar in northern Sierra Leone. These hard-working, dedicated, businesswomen want loans of SLL 1,000,000 per group member, in order to expand the size and quality of their respective businesses. This will lead to more sales and better profits. Mariatu is the featured leader of this group. A native of the town of Lunsar, the 35-year-old is married and has six children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary school. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for 10 years. She sells market food – palm-oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and the like. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi (a sweetener) and the like in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Dolores del socorro , mayor de edad, casada con una hija de dieciocho meses de edad que está a su cargo de ella, maestra y trabajador activo del Ministerio de educación, empezó su negocio cuando ella estaba estudiando, para ayudarse en el costo de sus estudios y así logro terminarlos,  Desde ese tiempo se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general entre ello ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, ella se abastece en Chinandega, compra de contado y sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante al contado y crédito, está solicitando préstamo, para capital de trabajo, ya que necesita invertir más en su negocio para suplir la demanda de sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y tener un mejor nivel de vida. Dolores agrade el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Dolores is an adult woman, married with one 18 month-old daughter who is in her care. She is a teacher and active employee of the Ministry of Education. She began her business when she was in school to help with the cost of her studies and in this manner she succeeded in completing them. 

Since that time she has made a living selling a variety of merchandise including clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She purchases supplies in Chinandega, buying in cash, and selling on foot for cash and on credit. She is requesting a loan for working capital for her business, now that she needs to invest more in her business to satisfy the demand of her customers, improve her income and have a better quality of life. 

Dolores appreciates the support that the Kiva investors offer to people of low economic means.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing for children, adults and young adults; as well as shoes and cosmetics among other things.

loans.name: Yesyema Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Yesyema Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and the Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 per group member, in order to invest in their respective businesses. Hassan is the featured leader of this group. Sixty-year-old Hassan is a native of Portloko town. He is married and the father of a few children. Hassan has been a businessman for many years. He sells market foods and, with the help of this loan, he is going to buy a large quantity of market foods to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of market food to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Sabenty-Iii Group

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Sabenty III Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and the Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 per group member, in order to invest in their respective businesses. Aminata is the featured leader of this group. Aminata is a 65-seven-year-old, married, and has four children. Aminata sells onions and has been a businesswoman for many years. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a larger quantity of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy more onions to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima del Rosario, mayor de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad  cursando la educación primaria y del domicilio de Chinandega, Fátima es una mujer luchadora que con su negocio ha mejorado su nivel de vida y apoya mucho en las necesidades del hogar, se dedica al destace de cerdos los fines de semanas donde ella vende deliciosos nacamatales, pepena, frito, charrascas y difrentes cortes de cerdos al igual que a diario vende verduras y frutas de manera ambulante en los repartos y comarcas aledañas, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, da crédito y lo recura semanalmente. Ella solicita financiamiento para invertir más en su negocio y así poder comprar mas cerdos, frutas y verduras, para suplir la demanda de sus clientes y así mejorar también sus ingresos. Ella se  encuentra muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kivas, por darles la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo y con acceso de pagos satisfactorios.
texts.en:
Fatima del Rosario is married and has a minor child in primary school, and the family lives in Chinandega.  Fatima is a hard worker who has been able to improve her lifestyle and contribute to the household needs through her business.  She sells pork on the weekends when she makes delicious nacatamales, pepena, cracklings and other pork products.  During the week she sells vegetables and fruits as a street vendor throughout the neighboring villages.  She has fixed and eventual customers who pay on a weekly credit basis.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and buy more pigs, fruits and vegetables to meets customer demand and increase her income.  She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity of obtaining a loan with easy payment terms.

loans.use: To invest in her pork business due to a significant increase in demand.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Ibrahim.  He is single, and has one child aged 10 years. In 2009, Ibrahim established his bike spare parts business. He began his business, because he wanted to generate income for development. His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his customers are people of his community. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours hours a day, he earns about Le900,000 every month from this business.

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan, in order to purchase bike spare parts for resale. In the future, Ibrahim plans to build a house of his own. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bike spare parts for his inventory

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Minda runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Minda has been in this business for 38 years.

In the future, Minda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata. She is 31 years old, married and has two children, aged 3 and 5 years old. In 1991, Aminata established her Rice by Bags business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of their home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Amanita requires a loan in order to buy 50 bags of rice, water, mega cola drinks and soft drinks. In the future, Aminata plans to assist her husband in completing the house they are now building and plans to educate their children up to university level. The loan helps Aminata to pay her children’s school fees  and with the additional profit she will pay for her shop rent. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of rice, water, mega cola drinks and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya,which is a primary milk producing area. He has two children and has been doing this work for three years. His primary income sources are eggs, milk and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'feeding his pigs' His biggest challenge is 'buying feed.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'the whites.'

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'jkl has very low interest loans.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'one should not divert funds to non intended assets.'

His highest monthly expense is lack of enough capital. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', David replied 'he will get enough cash for upkeep.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns the following: 'pig, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'cow, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water, sewing machine, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cow

loans.name: Salieu

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Salieu. He is married, and has 3 children aged 10, 7, and 1 years. He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him as an assistant. 

In 2000, Salieu established his electrical and building materials business. He began his business because he was not educated. His business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le5,000,000. Salieu requires a loan in order to buy more electrical and building material for resale. In the future, Salieu plans to open another shop to be controlled by his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more  electrical and building material for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Regina, who lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources, and where living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia. She is a college student, single, and has a two-year-old who is in school and lives at home. She started her business with a little money from her mother. Her business, which she been running for years, is now well-established. She sells oil, pepper, onions, rice and Vita (a fruit drink) from a table in the local market. She spends nine hours on her business. She faces a problem of small income. She is applying for a loan to buy more oil, pepper, onions, rice and Vita for her business. Her dreams are to open a shop one day, and to see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, onions, rice and Vita (a fruit drink) for her business.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Group

texts.en:
In Ranipur village, Nuapada district of Odisha, India, four active ladies came out and formed a Joint Liability Group named Jay Jagannath with the purpose of developing their existing trade by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Puspanjali, the energetic lady of 26 years sitting on the extreme left with raised hand, is one of them. She is very active and always cheerful. Her family consists of her husband and mother-in-law.

From last six years Puspanjali has been operating a cloth vending business with the help and support of her husband. She purchases sari and ready-made garments from the local market as well as from wholesale market 200 kilometers away. Her husband goes to different villages and weekly markets on a bike to sell saris and garments. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from her existing business, but the present income is like hand to mouth for her family. 

So Puspanjali wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. Looking into the present scenario of the market, from the present loan she is planning to purchase different varieties of saris and fancy garments to sell in the market. Puspanjali assumes that this will definitely generate some extra income because the festive seasons are forthcoming. Puspanjali has a strong desire to construct a house for herself and set up a cloth shop in her village.

The other three members of the group are Jasoda, Bimla and Rupa, managing a spice business, a general store and a dairy farm respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing different varieties of saris and fancy garments

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 24-year-old, married man. He has a child and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has had a bus for a few years. First, he saved a small amount of money, borrowing from his relative, in order to buy the bus. He has been offering bus transportation services to and from his city for some time now, and his work has kept him increasingly busy. He applied for a youth loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to buy another bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, de 40 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su pequeña hija a la que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Desde las primeras horas del día como hace 30 años recorre los terrenos agrícolas que heredó de sus padres y en donde siembra diversos productos agrícolas como: habas, papas y otros productos de la zona. Comenta que le gusta el trabajo en el campo y que dos veces al año siembra diversos productos, los que después cosecha y comercializa a la ciudad más cercana, aunque algunas veces los mismos comerciantes llegan a su misma zona a comercializar sus alimentos. Ahora desea continuar con la mejora de sus cultivos, pues dentro de poco empezará la siembra y desea mejorar cada día más. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Bertha, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a modest 40 year old woman. She lives with her young daughter whom she cares for in the house that she purchased a few years ago. 

From the early hours of each day, for about 30 years now, she goes over the farmland which she inherited from her parents, and on which she grows a variety of agricultural products such as broad beans, potatoes and other regional products. She says that she likes working on the land, and that twice a year she plants a variety of products which she later harvests and sells in the nearest city, although at times shop keepers/traders come directly to her region.

She now wishes to continue improving her crops, as she will shortly begin sowing seeds and would like to improve daily. This is her first loan from KIVA, and she is grateful for the financial support which allows her to move forward. She is also committed to making her payments in a punctual manner. Bertha will use the 800 soles to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish the fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 35-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five young children. 

She is in the gasoline retail business. She sells gasoline beside her home to earn a living; her husband works as a security guard. She has been in the gasoline retail business for more than five years. 

Vilma requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional gallon containers for gasoline storage, and more stock of gasoline in order to cater to the needs of her customers. 

In the future,Vilma would like to expand her gasoline retail business to provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy additional gallon containers for gasoline storage, and more stock of gasoline.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 24-year-old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources and where living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populous county in Liberia. She did not go to school, and she has three children between 4 and 9 years old, who are presently attending school. She and her fiancée are living together. She started in business by selling for her mother. For the past five years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant), where she sells rice and soup. She spends eight hours on her business. A problem she faces is her small income. She is applying for a loan to buy more fish, meat, rice, palm oil, Vita (a fruit juice drink), pepper, and the like, for her business. Her plan is to build a modern restaurant in the near future. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more fish, meat, rice, palm oil, Vita (a fruit drink), pepper, and the like, for her business.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Abdulhamid is 26 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been running an electrical shop. He has a good relationship with all of his customers. He started his business with a small amount of capital that allowed him to open his business. He said that the key to success as a merchant depends on attracting customers, and choosing stock that applies to their needs. 

Abdulhamid wants to expand his business more.  So he is applying for a youth loan of 400,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans, since his number of customers is increasing. He hopes to continue improving his business and pleasing his customers. He thanks Kiva lenders who supported him in the first loan.

loans.use: to buy electrical parts like lamps, wires, screwdrivers and fans for his business inventory

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marjorie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell for bamboo business.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en:
Nisa is 29 years old and married, with four children who are in school.  Nisa works very hard to provide for them.

Nisa runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, canned goods, milk, etc.

Nisa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Nisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, canned goods, and milk, etc

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Rowena has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, a 39-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, is a very hard working entrepreneur. For three years she has been operating a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soft drinks, canned goods, milk, coffee, soap, etc.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as soft drinks, canned goods, milk, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nenisa

texts.en:
Nenisa is 26 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.  

Nenisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed to sell.

Nenisa has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed to sell

loans.name: Shara

texts.en:
Shara is 31 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Shara is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Shara has been farming rice for nine years, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Shara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Este comité se inicio gracias a una de las miembros, quien quiso ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas y las formo y organizó, de allí surgió el grupo “Virgen de Fatima” y actualmente se encuentra en el 6º ciclo con 17 integrantes, son señoras muy activas destacadas en el ámbito del trabajo.
La Sra  Maria es una de las señoras que plenamente se dedica a su trabajo para cumplir con sus obligaciones, su actividad de todos los días se basa en la venta de ropas. Por medio de este trabajo esta ganándose el sustento y ayudando a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo para poder venderlas, como ser jeans, remeras, camisillas, abrigos y demás. Ellas gracias a su grupo también reciben capacitaciones para ir creciendo.
texts.en: This committee was begun thanks to one of its members, who wanted to help her friends and neighbours and got them together and organised them, forming a group which became the "Virgen de Fatima" group. Currently the group is in its sixth cycle with 17 members. They are very active women, noted for their hard work. Maria is one of the women who devotes herself fully to her work in order to fulfil her obligations. Her daily work is selling clothing. Through this work she is earning money for food and helping her family. She is asking for this loan to invest in buying all types of clothing to sell, such as jeans, t-shirts, vests, coats and other items. Thanks to their group they also receive training so they can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, vests, coats and other items.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número 10, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación de cada una y de esa forma poder esforzarse el doble en las áreas que necesitan. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ellas van haciendo, mejoran día a día.
Diana es parte de este grupo, quien por medio de las capacitaciones que esta recibiendo ha ido mejorando bastante su vida y la de su familia. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que lucha y se esfuerza por ir mejorando, es especial por su familia, quien es su inspiración.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, con lo cual podrá seguir haciendo su trabajo, dando a sus clientes la calidad a la que están acostumbrados y también mejorar su negocio y ayudar a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group is in its 10th cycle. They are doing the poverty elimination survey in order to get to know each member's situation, enabling them to double their efforts in areas of need. Through the hard work and continuous effort they are putting in, they are improving day by day. 

Diana is part of this group and through the training she is receiving she has greatly improved her own and her family's life. She is a very selfless person, who works hard and strives for improvement, especially for her family who are her inspiration. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy fabric and threads, with which she will be able to continue doing her work, giving her customers the quality they have become accustomed to and also improving her business and helping her family as she does so.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads for making garments.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Nasiru.  He is married and has no children.   In 2010, Nasiru established his Drinks, Milk, Mayonnaise etc. business. He began his business because he wanted to take care of his family. His business is located in the City Center and his main customers are the general public, men and women. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Nasiru requires a loan in order to buy more drinks, milk and mayonnaise for resale. In the future, Nasiru plans to open another bigger shop and build his own dwelling house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, milk and mayonnaise for resale.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Gibrilla.  He is married, and has two children, ages 15 and  7. 

In 2002, Gibrilla established his stationery business; he began his business because of low income. His business is located in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are school-going children, men and women. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Gibrilla requires a loan to buy more stationery to sell. 

In the future, Gibrilla plans to increase his stock prior to school starting by buying different kinds of stationeries. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stationery to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 38-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, ages 14, 12, and 9 years old, respectively. She is engaged in a buy-and-sell business. She sells items like mats, changing dishes, stock pots, and blankets. She has been into this buy-and-sell business for almost five years.

Vilma requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more blankets, mats, stock pots, and other kitchen utensils. In the future, Vilma would like to expand her buy-and-sell business to provide her children with proper diet and quality education.

loans.use: to buy more blankets, mats, stock pots, and other kitchen utensils for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
A 35-year-old married mother of four, Vilma  earns a living by  fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in the business for two years, and earns additional income from a general store. 

Vilma is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dreams: to save enough money to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobiles for personal use.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en:
$1,000 will help Palmira to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Palmira independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and a refrigerator to keep drinks.

loans.name: Campanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMPANITAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, venta de artículos varios, venta de coca, venta de ropa usada.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de mantas; este negocio lo emprendió por enseñanza de su hermana, quien conocía la técnica de tejido, y que posteriormente ella decide emprender su negocio independientemente utilizando sus ahorros.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital(compra de telas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “Campanitas” (Little Bells) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 7 members led by a governing board presided over by Virginia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: blanket weaving, food sales, assorted goods sales, coca leaf sales and used clothes sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Virginia.  She indicates that this is the first time she’s been part of Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisors that visited her at home.  She currently has a business manufacturing blankets that she started having learned from her sister who knew the weaving technique.  Later on she decided to start working independently using her savings.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric in street markets in the city of El Alto and after manufacture will sell in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family the best way possible because she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit and the savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene 36 años edad y tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica de la región del cusco, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante o puesto de venta en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cena. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carne, verduras y otras cosas más.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman that gets her family ahead, she is 36 years old and has three children, she sells typical food from the region of Cusco, she has a small restaurant or sale stand in one of the main markets of the city of Paucartambo, she makes breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's been several years that she has this business and she does well thanks to the effort she puts into it, she belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Carmen" and needs the loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, meat, vegetables and other items.

She is thankful and values the loan and commits to meet the repayments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, meat, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Darwin Julio

texts.es:
DARWIN tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos y con la conyugue en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Darwin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, ademàs se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, una bomba y polbillo. Con la ayuda del cre´dito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura y la alimentación de los animales.

el sueño es tener un regadío propio para los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar de los cultivos.
texts.en:
Darwin, 34, lives in a free union and has two children. He lives with his children and wife in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. He belongs to the communal bank La Chonta, located in Chonta in Ventanas canton, and he farms and fishes. 

Darwin grows corn and soybeans and raises pigs and chickens. He has applied for a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, and a pump and powder. He will be able to buy all the farming supplies and animal feed he needs with the loan. He dreams of having an irrigation system for his crops. In his free time, he likes to tend to his plantings.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, and a pump and powder.

loans.name: Sandra Gladys

texts.es:
SANDRA tiene 43 años de edad es divorsiada tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provicnica de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC la CHONTA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto la Chonta, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, soya, arroz. Solicita el credito para comprar insecticidas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crèdito podrá comprar los materiales para trabajar en el campo. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es tener mejores cosechas y por ende los ingresos que mejoren. En el tiempo libre le gusta despejar la mente paseando por el campo.
texts.en: Sandra is 43 and is divorced with two children. She lives with her children in Cantón Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the group VRC la CHONTA, who are located in the Recinto la Chonta area of Cantón Ventanas and work in agriculture and farming livestock. Sandra also works in agriculture growing corn, soya and rice. She is asking for a loan to buy insecticides and fertilisers. With the help of a loan she will be able to buy the materials she needs for working in the fields. She will purchase them in Ventanas. Her dream is to have better harvests and thereby increase her profits. In her free time she likes to clear her head by walking in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilisers.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Amanecer está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están con una gran expectativa de poder ser capacitadas, y de esa forma poder mejorar sus vidas e ir adquiriendo mayor conocimiento.
Soraida es una mujer ejemplar, luchadora, emprendedora, y que quiere trabajar para salir adelante, vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas que ella misma hace y con lo cual deleita a sus clientes. Hoy solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, huevos, tomate, lechuga, locotes, papa, cebolla y demás insumos que pueda necesitar para poder seguir haciendo sus ricas comidas.
Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad de acceder al crédito que recibe, ya que es la primera vez que recibe esta oportunidad
texts.en:
This group, named Amanecer [Daybreak], is in the first cycle of the women's committee program, in which they have great hope to be able to be trained and in this way to be able to improve their lives and continue acquiring more knowledge.

Soraida is an exemplary woman, determined, hard-working and willing to work to get ahead. She sells a variety of fast foods that she prepares herself and that her customers love. Today she is seeking part of this loan in order to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs, tomatoes, lettuce, green peppers, potatoes, onions and other supplies that she needs in order to be able to continue making her delicious food.

She is very grateful for this opportunity to obtain the loan that she is receiving, since it is the first time that she has had this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, eggs, tomatoes, lettuce, green peppers, potatoes, onions and other supplies.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 23 años, es soltera, y vive en su casa propia junta de sus padres. Karen se dedica a la venta de comidas  regionales, contando con un restaurante ubicado en su propia casa, donde tiene varias mesas y sillas para sus clientes, que son atendidos de manera amable y cordial. Además los fines de semana venden parrilladas de pollos que son muy requeridos por su buena sazón. Tiene más de 05 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su mamá es quien más la ayuda, atendiendo a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante que le sirve para pagar los gastos de su hogar. Considera rentable a su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, por tanto tiene planes de continuar en el negocio buscando hacerlo crecer. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado 300 nuevos soles, comprará ingredientes para  preparar sus comidas  como arroz, azúcar, y otros.
texts.en:
Karen is twenty-three years old, is single, and lives in at home with her parents.  Karen makes a living selling regional foods, and has a restaurant located in her own home.  She has several tables and chairs for her customers, and she attends to them with a kind and cordial manner.  Additionally, she sells barbecued chicken on the weekends, which is in demand because of its rich flavor.  

She has been dedicated to this work for more than five years.  So far, her mother is the person who has helped her most in attending to the clients.  She likes her business because she generates a stable economic income that helps her to cover the home expenses.  She considers her business to be profitable due to the earnings it has given her.  She has plans to continue with this business, and to find ways to make it grow.  

This will be her first loan with Kiva.  She hopes for your collaboration so that she can make her dreams come true.  With the amount she has requested (300 soles), she will invest in the purchase of the ingredients she needs in order to prepare her foods, like rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like rice and sugar, in order to prepare her food items.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
